creditline: Lent by the Museum of Early Southern Decorative Arts, Winston-Salem, North Carolina
description: curved horn; British ship entering Charleston on one side, small inset engraved with a dog and map of the Cherokee area of South Carolina on the other; inset at UR of map depicting a Native American holding a tomahawk and pointing a bow at a fort in a valley; body of the horn has an extended lobe with two holes engraved with diaper-work; top of the horn is turned with a set of rings in the center and a turned spout
title: Charleston Powder Horn
